entries.title: Elon Musk tells jury buying Tesla at $420 a share was no joke
entries.description: The Tesla chief returned to the witness stand on Monday to answer questions from lawyers for angry investors who accuse him of costing them millions of dollars with a pair of allegedly false tweets about having the funding secured to buy them out.

entries.title: French bakers protest over surging power prices
entries.description: Hundreds of bakers demonstrated in the streets of Paris on Monday to warn that the country's beloved bread and croissant makers were under threat from surging electricity and raw material costs.

entries.title: 2 students dead in Des Moines shooting
entries.description: The two students died at a hospital on Monday after being shot at their school. A teacher who was injured is in serious condition.

entries.title: Four Oath Keepers convicted of January 6 seditious conspiracy
entries.description: The verdict, announced on Monday, is another major victory for the Justice Department, which is also trying to secure sedition convictions against the former leader of the Proud Boys and four associates.

entries.title: ChatGPT in universities: A tool for teaching or cheating?
entries.description: In higher education, many professors are looking at OpenAI's powerful chatbot as a tool that can be beneficial to students. And so far, there have been no cheating scandals in France.

entries.title: In China, women are hesitant to have children: 'If I had one to raise, I would be poor'
entries.description: China's population declined in 2022, and authorities would like to encourage births. But many women feel they have too much to lose in marriage and motherhood.

entries.title: US Capitol rioter who put feet on Nancy Pelosi's desk convicted
entries.description: Richard 'Bigo' Barnett became infamous for propping up his feet on the House speaker's desk as Trump supporters invaded the Capitol building in January 2021.

entries.title: Moroccan lawmakers hit back at European Parliament after resolution on press freedom
entries.description: Last week, the European Parliament urged Morocco to 'respect freedom of expression and media freedom', citing prominent jailed journalists such as Omar Radi.

entries.title: EU imposes new sanctions on Iran over protest crackdown
entries.description: The group has once more stopped short of blacklisting the Revolutionary Guards as a terror group despite calls from Germany and the Netherlands to do so.

entries.title: South Africa hails friendship with Russia amid Ukraine war
entries.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov is on a visit to South Africa as joint maritime drills with Russia and China are to take place in the country in February.

entries.title: Five Germans charged over far-right coup plot
entries.description: The commando members, who identify themselves as 'citizens of the Reich' and don't recognize the legitimacy of Germany's 1949 constitution, was dismantled in December.

entries.title: Burkina Faso confirms asking France to withdraw troops
entries.description: Burkina Faso's state news agency reported the news on Saturday, but it was unclear whether a formal demand had effectively been passed on to Paris.

entries.title: Government body investigating sexism reports of French women's 'terrible' experiences
entries.description: An annual survey on sexism published on Monday shows that sexist behavior is still deeply rooted in French society, especially among young men.

entries.title: Commodities: 'Wheat prices are falling and returning to levels from before the war in Ukraine'
entries.description: Wheat prices are oscillating around €280 to €285 per ton, far from the record high of €438 per ton reached in mid-May 2022, notes 'Le Monde' economic columnist Laurence Girard.

entries.title: Lisa Marie Presley mourned by fans and celebrities at Graceland
entries.description: The musician and daughter of Elvis Presley was honored by her relatives, including her mother Priscilla Presley, as well as a range of musicians who preformed.

entries.title: Chris Hipkins set to replace Jacinda Ardern as New Zealand's prime minister
entries.description: The current Labour Party minister for police and education will replace Ardern, who has said she has no fuel left in the tank to fight the next round of legislative elections.

entries.title: Russia, Estonia expel ambassadors in tit-for-tat move
entries.description: Tensions between Russia and its European neighbors have spiked since Moscow invaded Ukraine last year.

entries.title: LA police seek motive in Lunar New Year mass shooting
entries.description: Police said the shooting took place late Saturday, January 21 at a ballroom dance studio in Monterey Park, a city of about 60,000 with a large Asian population celebrating the Lunar New Year.

entries.title: France and Germany reach a deceptive rapprochement
entries.description: Emmanuel Macron and Olaf Scholz made a show of symbolism on Sunday in Paris for the 60th anniversary of the Elysée Treaty, but they didn't come up with any strong proposals on support for Ukraine, European defense or the energy crisis.

entries.title: Potential exit of French special forces from Burkina Faso triggers confusion
entries.description: Paris says it has not been informed of Ouagadougou's reported willingness to cancel a defense agreement between the two countries.

entries.title: QR codes are set to gradually replace barcodes on consumer products
entries.description: The new system will enable the integration of data over the entire life of a product.

entries.title: The marathon of the French pension reform is just kicking off
entries.description: Faced with a strong movement against his plan, Emmanuel Macron's government is sticking to its highly controlled public messaging as it prepares for an inevitable legislative battle.

entries.title: Two Paris police officers questioned after shooting man dead
entries.description: The victim was armed and had allegedly threatened first a dog and then the officers before they opened fire.

entries.title: French police launch internal investigation after protester has testicle removed due to police blow
entries.description: The 26-year-old, who was in the January 19 Paris demonstration against the pension reform, was hit on the ground with a truncheon by a police officer.

entries.title: China faces unprecedented population decline
entries.description: The country's population fell from 1.413 to 1.412 billion last year.

entries.title: Poland to ask Germany for permission to send tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Poland's prime minister also promised to hand over their tanks to Ukraine even if Germany refuses the request.

entries.title: Rugby: The French Federation faces uncertain days
entries.description: Amateur clubs will vote from January 23 to 26 on whether or not to approve Patrick Buisson, chosen as interim president by Bernard Laporte after he stepped back following his conviction for corruption.

entries.title: Gifts received by British MPs revealed to the public
entries.description: Two media outlets have published a database listing donations – which are unlimited thanks to lenient legislation – received by MPs since late 2019.

entries.title: Australian Open: Magda Linette shocks number four ranked Caroline Garcia
entries.description: The French world number four became the latest top seed to suffer an early exit at the first Grand Slam of the year.

entries.title: France's great retirement inequality: Women's pensions are much smaller than men's
entries.description: The average pension for women in France is 28% lower than for men. This inequality stems from career breaks, wage gaps, and the choice of lower-paying professions – and from norms and differences instilled from childhood.

entries.title: Pension inequalities persist between women and men in Italy
entries.description: The disparity in labor market access and participation between men and women continues to widen the gap in pension payouts in Italy, with women's pensions on average representing 60% of those received by men.

entries.title: ChatGPT: 'More than in a surveillance capitalism, here we are in an administration of our well-being'
entries.description: Philosopher Eric Sadin warns, in an article published in 'Le Monde,' of the 'civilizational' risk of seeing an industrialized language 'taking the place of' human language.

entries.title: On pensions, Swedish women lag behind men
entries.description: Nearly 20 years after the introduction of the points-based pension system in Sweden, a significant disparity in pension payouts remains, with women receiving on average 30% less than men.

entries.title: France will lower gas reservoir levels to provide 'breathing room'
entries.description: Gas reservoirs, which are historically high, will be reduced for technical reasons, while risk of shortages in the context of the Russian-Ukrainian war is declining.

entries.title: Xavier Dolan: 'I feel like I've said everything I needed to say'
entries.description: The Canadian director announced he is taking a break from making his own films –but not from acting.

entries.title: Pegasus, Israel and a massacre of Mexican students
entries.description: Israel refuses to extradite a former Mexican judge who is accused of sabotaging the investigation into the disappearance of 43 students while using the Pegasus software to spy on the defenders of the victims.
